originalText.text: We had a funeral for our mother last week, and the staff at Plaza Jewish was kind, helpful and professional. One of the staff had come down with Covid as were were in the midst of planning, and someone immediately stepped into his place. In particular, we want to thank Gregory Katz. His steady presence at the funeral itself--telling us what would happen, making sure we were safe, guiding us through the entire process--was an amazing source of support. Thank you to everyone for making a sad occasion easier.

originalText.text: As relatives from out-of-state who were arranging for the burial of a family member in NYC, we were fortunate to work with the compassionate, professional, and knowledgeable staff at Plaza.  I appreciated that Plaza is a non-profit organization governed by a board of rabbis.  The staff was attentive to our needs and understood our preferences for a meaningful yet modest burial and graveside service.  They informed us about cost-saving options, such as using a black SUV instead of a hearse, and found the perfect rabbi who matched our family sensibilities and religious practices.  The Plaza staff at the cemetery ensured that the graveside service was flawless.  I highly recommend Plaza.

originalText.text: Our Mother passed away this summer and even though we had every expectation of going to Riverside Memorial Chapel (which hosted services for many members of our family over decades), after transporting her body there, a summer renovation and a lack of AC during one of the hottest weeks of the summer forced a panicked pivot making calls from the sidewalk, first to Frank E Campbell (also under renovation) and then, happily to Plaza JC Chapel. With just a few minutes notice, we went to meet with them. From the minute we walked in, Gregory was incredibly comforting in assuring us that everything was going to be fine, and then the Plaza team delivered on all assurances. Preps went smoothly, costs were provided up-front, the funeral (in the comfortable, modern chapel on the second floor - with escalator/bathrooms easily accessible) was lovely and they expertly handled all logistics with the cemetery in Queens, where we had small gravesite ceremony. Gregory was so skilled in advising and guiding us through a difficult time, we will always be grateful. We received a lot of positive feedback about the service and chapel from those who attended, and have been telling everyone we know about our experience. Lucky to have Plaza Jewish in the city - exactly what we needed (and didn't even know it existed). Thank you!

originalText.text: Gregory Katz at Plaza Jewish helped me plan and carry out my mom’s funeral. He handled and guided me through every step of the way and was always available to talk with.  His kind and responsible manner made this tough time as easy as possible.  I still can’t believe how much he and the staff were able to do.  He arranged everything and even after the funeral he is still in touch regarding the unveiling.  Thank you so much…

originalText.text: My mother purchased a prepaid funeral  (which I would highly recommend) at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel. I can not say enough about this experience. My mom died 250 miles away from New York City. Plaza quickly arranged for transport back to NY. Every detail of the funeral, service and burial was handled efficiently and with kindness. Communication via phone and email was handled so well. I couldn't have imagined a more seamless process.
